newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Belgian Boel workers accept Hoogovens steel deal.
newsitem.headline: Belgian Boel workers accept Hoogovens steel deal.

text.p: Workers at Belgian steel firm Usines Gustaves Boel (UGB), which is negotiating an alliance with the Dutch steel group Hoogovens, on Friday voted to accept the restructuring aspects of the merger plan.
"An agreement has been reached, forced by (the threat) of bankruptcy," Roger Leclercq, representative of the socialist FGTB trade union, told Belgian television.
Hoogovens aims to take a 50 percent stake and invest 3.0 billion Belgian francs in Boel. The plan involves the loss of 800 jobs, reducing the workforce to 1,200.
Family-owned Boel had warned workers on Monday that it might file for bankruptcy, after unions blocked an earlier referendum on the merger plan.

Workers softened their position on Wednesday after meeting with representatives of the Dutch steel maker and hearing more details and assurances. However the FGTB union's Leclercq said on Friday they were still worried about the future.
"They still fear for the electric furnace...that intentions (to maintain it) will be dropped in favour of profit," he said.
